title: BBC Local Live: Devon and Cornwall on Friday 15 December 2017 - BBC News
summary: councillor douglas hellier-laing jailed for attacking wife .
cornwall local football manager trevor mewton dies .
nightclub death teenagers took ecstasy and amphetamine .
man suffers life-changing injuries in a30 crash .
police renew appeal for missing devon teenager .
'i can not live in a travelodge ' says devon mud hut woman .
people finding it more difficult to see gps - watchdog .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 07:00 on monday .

documents.title: baby rescued after getting locked in bedroom of flat
text: a baby has had to be rescued in north devon after getting locked in the bedroom of a first-floor flat .
firefighters said they rescued the child on tuesday night after they got into the flat in torridge view , torrington , by using a ladder .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more than 100 jobs lost at marine firm
text: more than 100 jobs lost at marine firm

documents.title: bloodhound jet car heading to south africa after cornwall
text: a british car designed to reach 1,000mph - which has been trialled in cornwall - will be tested for the first time on its south african dry bed race track in october next year .
bloodhound ssc will be tested at hakskeen pan , northern cape , with the team behind the supersonic car aiming for a 500mph milestone .
the car is fitted with an ej200 jet engine , which has been sourced from a eurofighter typhoon aircraft .
in october , bloodhound , driven by ex-raf fighter pilot andy green , reached 200mph during trials at cornwall airport in newquay .
the team said the trials would test its performance and handling during one of its most vulnerable phases : between 400mph and 500mph .
the dried-out lake bed is super-flat and extends for 12 miles ( 19km ) , providing ample space to get up to some very high speeds and then slow and stop safely .
the team is aiming to go 800mph in 2019 , and then up to 1,000mph in 2020 .

documents.title: more than 100 jobs lost at marine firm
text: more than 100 jobs lost at marine firm

documents.title: cafes , bars and businesses join water refill scheme
text: nearly 150 cafes , bars and other businesses in devon are offering free water refills to anyone who wants them .
they 've joined a scheme called refill , which aims to cut down on the amount of single-use water bottles going to waste .
thousands of bottles end up in the sea every year , causing pollution and harming wildlife .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: weather : dry and clear before showers on saturday
text: tonight will be dry and clear for most , although a few showers will continue in the west .
winds will ease after midnight , allowing a touch of ground frost in places by morning .
minimum temperature : 3c ( 37f )
saturday is expected to be dry and sunny through the morning , but it will cloud over at times in the afternoon with some showers developing late in the day .
maximum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: search for missing teen extended to include river
text: police searching for a missing 15-year-old from devon have extended their search for him around a river .
daniel chambers , from tipton st john , was last seen at his home address two days ago .
he did n't catch his bus to school .
it is believed he likes to visit sidmouth and beer .
officers said they were `` becoming increasingly concerned '' for his welfare and searches had been extended to include in and around the river otter .

det ch insp stuart cavin , of devon and cornwall police , said : `` we are appealing to people who know and use the walkways around the river otter , particularly between tipton st john up to ottery st mary .
`` we know that daniel used this area and we think he may well have been seen by many walkers and other members of the public who use these paths . ''
he is described as white , about 6ft ( 1.9m ) tall , slim , with short dark brown hair and clean shaven .
he was last seen wearing dark-coloured chinos and a grey hoodie with horizontal stripes on the back .
it is believed he is carrying a black rucksack with a green-coloured dc logo .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hospital patients in corridors and on trolleys in alert
text: patients have been waiting in corridors and on trolleys at the royal cornwall hospital on the outskirts of truro because the number of people turning up at its emergency department has risen by 50 % at times , staff say .
a spokesman for the hospital said earlier this afternoon that it was back on its highest level of alert - level 4 , formerly known as black alert - with very few beds available for new admissions .
director of patient flow duncan brown said there had been `` overwhelming demand '' and the emergency department had recently seen 60 to 80 patients in it instead of an average of 40 to 50 .
a lack of beds had also meant some could not be admitted into the hospital from the department .
he said : `` we have had people having to stay in the corridor , but it 's certainly not the place we would like to keep our patients . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: cornwall travel : car goes into wall in falmouth
text: in falmouth , avenue road is partially blocked by an accident near lansdowne road , near the train station .
a vehicle has left the road and gone into a wall .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: totnes public toilets closed at christmas due to drug use
text: some public toilets in totnes are being closed over christmas because of public safety concerns after continued drug use and drugs paraphernalia being discarded in them , a council says .

south hams council said toilets at coronation road , steamer quay and the civic hall had been recommended for temporary closure because of `` a minority of users in the town '' from 20 december until after the new year .
`` this poses a very real risk to both members of the public and the people the council employ to clean the toilets , '' it said .
the closures would be reviewed in january , the council added .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tro turtle died after being 'very weak from ordeal '
text: a rare tro turtle found washed up on a cornwall beach had been `` weak from its ordeal '' before it died , an aquarium says .
the kemp 's ridley turtle , an endangered species , was being cared for by the blue reef aquarium in newquay after being found freezing cold and exhausted on holywell beach last week .
the aquarium confirmed on friday it had died .
it was believed to have travelled from its natural habitat near mexico or texas .
aquarium curator steve matchett said : `` when the turtle arrived at the aquarium , it was very weak from its ordeal , plus we could see that there was extensive damage to the shell .
`` when turtles end up off course and enter colder waters , they can quickly become exhausted and are unable to feed as they get too cold .
`` this greatly weakens the turtle and , by the time they have washed ashore , sometimes receiving further injuries from collisions with shore-line rocks , they are dehydrated and very weak . ''
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gp survey 'to show pressures in the system '
text: cornwall 's health watchdog is carrying out an in-depth survey on gp services so health commissioners can get a better of pressures in the system , it says .

people were finding it increasingly difficult to access appointments , flagging up issues such as surgery closures or new housing putting pressure on appointment availability , healthwatch cornwall said .
it said it hoped to use the results to help with planning new or alternative options .
amanda stratford , from the watchdog , said : `` the whole point of it really is to get that in-depth information to share with [ commissioning organisation ] nhs kernow .
it can take and use it in terms of influencing services .
`` there are fewer gps , there are gps retiring , and all sorts of pressures on the system . ''
the government said it was putting more money into primary care and offering golden hellos to doctors for areas struggling with such pressures , such as cornwall .
the survey is open until 19 january .
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: labour 'to confirm study to make a38 like motorway '
text: there have been calls recently for the motorway to be extended from exeter to plymouth .
it currently finishes at exeter , with the a38 then providing a dual carriageway route on to plymouth .
plymouth city council voted in november to press the government to commission an appraisal so the cost and timescale can be established .

plymouth mp @ twitterid says he thinks @ twitterid will `` confirm very shortly '' support for a study saying any new upgrade work on the a38 from exeter to plymouth should be done to motorway standard .

forget a motorway , a few quid towards basic improvements to reach minimum a-road standards & eliminate obvious black-spots which repeatedly and regularly create traffic chaos causing the region millions of pounds in lost-time would be nice .
@ twitterid ?
e.g .
right now
simply poor junction design .
the a38 needs variable speed limits at peak times , traffic-light controls on 'on-ramps ' , carriageway warnings lights for on-traffic , and no-overtaking zones adjacent to specific on-ramps .
@ twitterid
author: Martyn Oates
BBC South West Political Editor

documents.title: wife attack councillor 'was seven out of 10 drunk '
text: a senior devon councillor who attacked his wife with a wooden mallet had been drinking tia maria and polish brandy prior to the attack , a court heard .

sixty-seven-year-old douglas hellier-laing , who has resigned from teignbridge district council , was jailed for three years for the attack in october during which the councillor hit his wife three times .
hellier-laing , of clifford street , chudleigh , pleaded guilty to wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm at a previous hearing at exeter crown court .
he said it was a `` moment of madness '' , and described his drunkenness as a seven out of 10 .
sentencing , judge graham cottle said : `` it is not really clear why you did what you did on that day in question . ''
he added : `` i would have thought drinking must have had something to do with the way you reacted and had you been sober you would have reacted in a different way . ''
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: marine engineering firm goes into administration
text: a marine engineering company based in dover has gone into administration , with the loss of 106 jobs .
burgess marine also had premises in lowestoft , southampton , poole , portsmouth , portchester , avonmouth , devonport and palma de mallorca in spain .
the administrators , bdo , said it was due to not receiving the final payment for a major refit project carried out at porchester earlier this year .

burgess marine 's bases in lowestoft , avonmouth and poole are continuing to trade as normal after they were bought by southampton ship repair company southampton marine services ltd , saving 45 jobs .
the dover hq employed 32 people , four of whom have been kept on to help with the winding down of the firm .

regrettably , difficult trading conditions and a shortfall in the company 's working capital position - contributed to by a failure to secure the final payment due in regard to a recent major refit project - significantly affected the business and its ongoing viability . ''
author: Bob Dale
BBC Live reporter

documents.title: rare rescued turtle dies
text: an injured tro turtle which was found washed up on a cornwall beach has died , an aquarium says .
the rare kemp 's ridley turtle was found by dave hudson , a conservation and biodiversity student from exeter university , last friday .
it was being cared for by staff at the blue reef aquarium in newquay after being found freezing cold and exhausted .
it was believed to have travelled from its natural habitat near mexico or texas .
the shell of the turtle , an endangered species , had been damaged and it appeared extremely weak and dehydrated when it was found .
the aquarium said : `` despite an encouraging initial response to treatment , the turtle 's injuries were likely too extensive and the turtle too weak to fully recover . ''
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wife attack councillor left authority after guilty plea
text: a senior devon councillor jailed for three years for attacking his wife with a wooden mallet resigned from the local authority he worked on after pleading guilty .
douglas hellier-laing , 67 , hit his wife , susan , in the head three times before phoning police to confess .
mrs hellier-laing , 59 , was treated for serious injuries after the attack on 29 october , exeter crown court heard .
her husband , a cabinet member of conservative-led teignbridge district council , admitted wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm .
hellier laing , of clifford street , chudleigh , was the executive member for economy , skills and tourism at teignbridge district council until resigning .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: royal cornwall hospital on full capacity alert
text: the royal cornwall hospital in truro is on a level four alert - what used to be known as a black alert .
it means it is effectively at full capacity .

the royal cornwall hospitals nhs trust said it was taking action within the hospital , implementing its full capacity protocol , as well as working in the wider community to respond to the situation .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: christmas drugs warning after deaths
text: christmas drugs warning after deaths

documents.title: pirates bring in exeter prop owlett
text: pirates bring in exeter prop owlett

documents.title: devon travel : serious accident on tavistock road , plymouth
text: devon travel : serious accident on tavistock road , plymouth
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: moped seized by police investigating helmet-less riders
text: police in brixham who have been investigating reports that a motorbike was being used by youths without helmets on have seized a moped .
officers said on facebook the bike was seized this morning and it had been reported stolen previously .
inquiries were continuing , police added .
a crash helmet must be worn by law when riding a moped on the road .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: councillor jailed for mallet attack
text: councillor jailed for mallet attack

documents.title: builders told to stop work on 1,600-home development
text: work on a major housing scheme in devon has been halted following complaints construction is going on beyond agreed hours at the weekends .
persimmon homes has been told to stop working past 13:00 on saturdays and sundays on its saltram meadow development - a massive new estate in plymstock .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: devon travel : burst water main lifts section of a3052
text: a3052 burst water main has lifted the road near to turning for aylesbeare gang operating stop & go while awaiting temp traffic lights .
police have informed @ twitterid delays likely hg

documents.title: 'allergy to modern life ' pair reject hotel offer
text: a couple living in a mud-hut home have rejected a council offer of accommodation in a travelodge .
kate and alan burrows built their home in north devon from tree trunks , mud and straw because they say they have an `` allergy to modern life '' .
north devon council has issued an enforcement notice for them to remove their home , which does not have planning permission , by saturday .
the couple , who have lived on their smallholding in the tarka valley near chulmleigh since 2015 , say they would rather the offer was made to homeless people .
planning officer mike kelly said the authority was `` supportive of sustainable development '' but it `` does not mean allowing people to develop wherever they wish '' .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon travel : accident on tavistock road , plymouth
text: in plymouth , on tavistock road , there are reports of an accident heading inbound between the woolwell roundabout and the george junction .
there 's slow traffic
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: rugby : pirates need more fire in the belly - paver
text: the cornish pirates take on scarlets select this sunday in a repeat of monday 's fixture .
the pirates lost 18-10 in wales and will be looking for revenge at the mennaye field .
coach alan paver played at aberavon , and the veteran prop said he was looking forward to another run out .
he said : `` we just need to see a little more fire in the belly and improvement in our performance . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: councillor attacked his wife in 'moment of madness '
text: a devon district councillor jailed for attacking his wife hit her in a `` moment of madness '' , a court has heard .

sixty-seven-year-old douglas hellier-laing , a cabinet member at devon 's teignbridge district council , was sentenced to three years for the attack , where he hit her three times with a mallet in october .
hellier-laing , of clifford street , chudleigh , pleaded guilty to wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm at a previous hearing at exeter crown court .
mrs laing told the court in a statement that `` i do n't think i 'll ever be the same again . ''
the defence spoke of his `` outstanding record of public service '' as a local councillor , and that it was a `` very sad case '' .
judge graham cottle agreed to a restraining order being put in place .
author: Harriet Bradshaw
Reporter

documents.title: 'look after friends ' plea after teenagers ' drug deaths
text: a coroner has appealed for people to `` look after your mates '' at an inquest which heard how two teenagers died after taking a combination of drugs .

andrew reilly , a mechanic from chagford , newton abbot , and joshua lee brock , a student from hatherleigh , both 19 , fell unconscious in pryzm nightclub , plymouth and were confirmed dead in the early hours of 9 december .
plymouth coroner 's court , heard that the pair had taken `` mandy '' , a mix of mdma ( ecstasy ) and amphetamines .

senior coroner ian arrow said : `` in this party season , i do hope the publicity surrounding these tragic deaths will alert families to the importance of discussing what is safe to consume on a night out .
`` tabs , tablets , powder or excess alcohol rarely result in a pleasant convivial evening with friends .
please , look after your mates . ''
the precise medical cause of death was still currently unknown , the hearing was told .
the inquest is due to resume on 13 april .
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: mud hut pair reject travelodge offer
text: mud hut pair reject travelodge offer

documents.title: 'i can not live in a travelodge ' says devon mud hut woman
text: a woman living in a mud-hut home says she would be `` bedridden '' if she took up a council offer of accommodation in a travelodge .
north devon council has issued an enforcement notice for kate burrows and her husband alan to remove their home , which does not have planning permission , by saturday .
the couple have appealed against the enforcement order , citing illness from a condition called multiple chemical sensitivity ( mcs ) , but this was rejected .
mrs burrows , who has lived in the house made of tree trunks , straw and mud at chulmleigh since 2015 , said : `` i can not live in that way .
i have been in one before and i could not sleep , i would be so ill in 24 hours . ''
what is multiple chemical sensitivity ( mcs ) ?
mcs is a chronic , physical illness affecting people of all ages and backgrounds .
it causes sufferers to have allergic-type reactions to very low levels of chemicals in everyday products .
put simply , the immune and detoxification systems stop working properly and the body can not process toxins efficiently .
besides reacting to things like cleaning products , shampoo , perfumes and pesticides , many sufferers are also sensitive to food , medicines , moulds and electromagnetic fields .
source : mcs-aware
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather : blustery showers to the west , drier elsewhere
text: blustery showers will continue to affect parts of west cornwall and scilly , but elsewhere it 'll be drier with sunny spells more widespread .
moderate or fresh northwesterly winds will be stronger around exposed coasts , high ground and generally to the west .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: breakingnightclub death teenagers took ecstasy and amphetamine
text: two teenagers who died in a plymouth nightclub had taken a combination of ecstasy and amphetamine , an inquest has heard .

aaron reilly , a mechanic from chagford , newton abbot , and joshua lee brock , a student from hatherleigh , both 19 , fell unconscious in pryzm nightclub , plymouth and were confirmed dead in the early hours of 9 december .

providing evidence in plymouth coroner 's court , coroner 's officer mr andrew bolter said that mr reilly had told staff at the nightclub that the pair had taken `` mandy '' , a mix of mdma ( ecstasy ) and amphetamines .
cpr was administered on site by bar staff and continued by medical staff , but both were pronounced dead at 02:50 and 02:53 respectively on 9 december at derriford hospital .
the precise medical cause of death was still currently unknown , the hearing in plymouth was told .
the inquest will resume on 13 april .
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: councillor 's attacked wife 'thought she was going to die '
text: a woman attacked by her local councillor husband with a mallet thought she was going to die , prosecutors have told a court .
sixty-seven-year-old douglas hellier-laing , a cabinet member at devon 's teignbridge district council , has been jailed for three years for attacking his wife , hitting her three times .
hellier-laing , of clifford street , chudleigh , pleaded guilty to wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm at a previous hearing at exeter crown court .
during sentencing , the court heard how mrs laing was collecting her things from their home to go and stay with her mother .
the couple had been living separate lives but under the same roof with the plan to divorce .
she saw a flash of her husband with a co-op bag with something in it .
one injury needed nine stitches .
neighbours helped mrs laing when she came to them she was covered in blood with one main wound `` pulsing with blood '' , the court heard .
in a statement read in court , mrs laing said : `` i do n't think i 'll ever be the same again .
i 'm not living , i 'm just existing .
i just want to hide away . ''
author: Harriet Bradshaw
Reporter

documents.title: breakingcouncillor douglas hellier-laing jailed for attacking wife
text: a devon district councillor has been jailed for three years for attacking his wife .
douglas hellier-laing , 67 , a cabinet member at teignbridge district council , devon , attacked his wife with a wooden mallet on 29 october , exeter crown court heard .
hellier-laing , of clifford street , chudleigh , had pleaded guilty to wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm at a previous hearing .
author: Harriet Bradshaw
Reporter

documents.title: football : truro going up against sutton to win - mchale
text: truro city will be looking to cause a shock in the fa trophy tomorrow .
they 're away to national league team sutton united .
goalkeeper tom mchale says his side are the underdogs , but they 're going to give it their all .
he said : `` we 're there to do a job .
who knows what will happen , but we are going up there to win . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: no cop out : criminals ' cash funds brews with blues scheme
text: cash seized from criminals is being used in an initiative to bring police closer to hard-to-reach communities in newquay , officers say .
the # brewswithblues project is being run in cafes across newquay , and is seeing members of the public being invited to drop-in for a free cuppa with local police .
the scheme - inspired by projects in the united states , coffee with a cop - is being funded by money recovered from the proceeds of crime act .
officers are initially running 45-minute drop-ins once a week for eight weeks .
the dates and locations are being advertised locally in the town and on social media .
police using proceeds of crime cash to buy for the people of newquay # brewswithblues
author: Ben Woolvin
BBC South West Home Affairs correspondent

documents.title: christmas market comes to festive nursing home
text: what happens if you want to visit a christmas market , but getting out and about is n't easy because you 're frail ?
one nursing home in exeter has come up with a solution : bringing the outside inside and staging its very own christmas market for residents and their families .
it is a scaled-down version of the sort of market you would find in cities , according to the the organiser of the event at the old rectory nursing home in exeter , manager paul courtney .
he said : `` we 've got six stalls , plus a stage for acts going on , and a pretty authentic christmas grotto for families and friends . ''
author: Gordon Sparks
Presenter, BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: a sunny morning in exeter for the police helicopter
text: the aircraft is based at exeter and is one of 15 national police air service bases providing air support to england and wales ' 43 police forces .
morning tweeters # npas44 fully fuelled and awaiting deployment - nice sunny devon day thankfully
great shot .
not jealous at all , no sir !
are you taking part in 'christmas helmet day ' this year ?
lol !
it looks like something we should be getting involved in
beautiful morning here in newport gwent as well makes a change
to be fair , we 're pretty lucky in devon with the sunshine but always a welcome addition to the day , especially in december
i love devon i always visit dawlish in the summer yes mad to see the sun in december
beautiful looking ec145 hope to maybe see u soon

documents.title: school starts own food bank to help local community
text: students at a school in cornwall have started their own food bank to help their community .

the year 9 citizenship group at pool academy , near camborne , has spent time learning about local charities during the lead-up to christmas , and how the festive season could be very hard for some people .
one lesson has been about the cpr food bank , which supports people in camborne , pool and redruth .
this inspired students to encourage everyone to donate to their own food bank box in the school 's reception .
student katie said it had been important to learn how much people might need .
she said : `` it 's been interesting to learn about how much people need help to feed their families .
it 's really important to me , as well as other people in my class . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: further tributes to cornwall local football manager mewton
text: more tributes have been paid on social media to legendary cornwall local football manager trevor mewton , who died this morning .
he managed many clubs in cornwall , enjoying immense success with st blazey .
tributes have come from other sporting organisations , as well as individuals around the county .
very sad waking up to the news that trevor mewton has passed away .
had many a long conversation with trevor about football , which he lived and breathed .
cornish football will be a poorer place without him .
thoughts are with trevor 's family and friends .
rest in peace .
rrip trevor mewton .
thoughts go out to all his family and friends from everyone at penryn athletic .
sad sad news for everyone in the footballing world
rip trevor mewton , a man who did so much for local sport .
gutted to hear about trevor mewton passing away .
was such a lovely bloke , always a great interviewee and a huge fan of soul music .
thoughts are with jill and the rest of the family # rip # topbloke
very sad indeed .
i interviewed trevor when i was at @ twitterid in the late 80 's and early 90 's .
very nice bloke , always talked football sense great interviewer .
rip
sad news .
dad is most upset having played football with him .
such sad news , this morning , a true legend of cornish football , trevor mewton has passed away .
my thoughts are with his family at this difficult time # cornishfootball # legend # rip
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pub and club ban warning over festive period
text: police in the truro area are warning people that anyone who causes trouble during the festive period and finds themselves banned from one pub or club will actually be `` banned from all '' .

the truro neighbourhood team said the majority of local pubs and clubs operated a policy that , `` should you cause any trouble , you will be asked to leave and then banned from entering other premises '' .
officers added : `` this has been a very successful approach in the past .
do n't ruin your night out , or that of your friends . ''
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: devon travel : road accidents in plympton and plymstock
text: devon travel : road accidents in plympton and plymstock
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: council denies removing memorial to murdered man
text: devon county council has denied being behind the removal of a floral memorial created near the spot where a much-loved man was murdered on new year 's day in 2015 .
the memorial to tanis bhandari was built on a trough originally set down in the 1980s and a workman removed it this week , claiming it was on the orders of the council .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: twelve devon schools fall in new tables
text: twelve devon schools have fallen below the `` floor '' of acceptable performance , and are underperforming in terms of the percentage of pupils reaching the expected level and progress scores .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: councils begin emergency protocol to help rough sleepers
text: rough sleepers in devon are being urged to get in touch with councils if they need help .
south hams and west devon councils said they had activated their severe weather emergency protocols .
the authorities said they were offering accommodation to those they knew to be sleeping rough .

staff added that they were working with local support groups to encourage people to take up offers of help `` during the current cold snap and throughout winter , when the risk of illness or permanent harm is so much higher '' .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: man suffers life-changing injuries in a30 crash
text: a man is still in hospital in a serious condition following a crash on the a30 in cornwall , police say .
the driver was injured when his fiat panda crashed on the westbound slip road at scorrier at about 17:40 on thursday , devon and cornwall police said .
the 59-year-old , from camborne , was airlifted to derriford hospital in plymouth by air ambulance .
he suffered life-changing injuries , police said .
officers have appealed for witnesses and any dashcam footage .

documents.title: breakingcornwall local football manager trevor mewton dies
text: tributes are being paid to legendary cornwall local football manager trevor mewton , who has died this morning .
mewton managed many clubs in cornwall and enjoyed immense success with st blazey .
the club has tweeted his morning that it was `` very sad '' to hear the news that it 's most successful manager had passed away and the club 's thoughts are with his family .
very sad to wake up to the horrible news that club legend and our most successful manger of all time , trevor mewton , has sadly passed away .
our thoughts are with all of trevor 's family and friends at this tragic time .
i mirror your sentiments and hope we can give him a geat game to watch from the skies when we host you at penzance on 29th december .
trevor will be sadly missed by us all .
unbelievable news .
amazing memories that will live on thats for sure .
thoughts with all his family and friends .
a true gent and one i always enjoyed talking to on the radio !
thoughts with family and friends
author: Ross Ellis
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: plymouth pryzm nightclub deaths : inquests due to open
text: inquests are expected to be opened later into the deaths of two teenagers who died after a night out in plymouth .
police said aaron reilly , from newton abbot , and joshua brock , from okehampton - both aged 19 - lost their lives after taking a form of the drug ecstasy .
they collapsed in the pryzm nightclub and died later at derriford hospital .
an 18-year-old arrested in connection with the deaths in plymouth has been released under investigation .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: weather : sunshine and showers , with some hail possible
text: it will be a bright day with sunny periods , although a scattering of showers at first , these often blustery and mixed with hail .
feeling chilly in the brisk northerly wind .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: house fire in penzance
text: fire crews from five towns were called to a blaze in penzance overnight .
cornwall fire and rescue service said crews were called to the house fire in adelaide street at about 03:00 after reports of smoke coming from the building .
crews from penzance , falmouth , hayle , st ives and st just extinguished the blaze .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: people finding it more difficult to see gps - watchdog
text: people are finding it increasingly difficult to access gp appointments , according to cornwall 's health watchdog .
healthwatch cornwall said people had been flagging up issues such as surgery closures or new housing putting pressure on appointment availability .
it has launched a survey in bid to get a fuller of the issue after getting feedback suggesting experiences vary across practices .
it said it hoped to use the results to help with planning new or alternative options .
the survey is open until 19 january .
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: power work closes primary school
text: delaware primary academy in cornwall is closed today , staff say .
the school , in drakewalls , gunnislake , said it was shut because electrical engineers were cutting power to it for the morning which would leave it without heating and lighting .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: notebook clue to glenn miller mystery
text: notebook clue to glenn miller mystery

documents.title: two motorists injured in two serious a30 crashes
text: two motorists were injured in two serious crashes on the same stretch of the a30 on thursday , emergency services have said .
a driver was airlifted to hospital after a single vehicle crash at just after 09:00 near tolvaddon .
the a30 was closed in both directions .
just before 18:00 emergency services were called to the a30 near scorrier , to rescue a driver trapped in a vehicle after a crash .
the driver was then taken by ambulance to the royal cornwall hospital before being transferred to derriford hospital in plymouth by air ambulance .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police renew appeal for missing devon teenager
text: police have renewed an appeal for a missing 15-year-old from devon .
daniel chambers , from tipton st john , was last seen at his home address by his parents two days ago .
he did n't catch his bus to school .
it is believed he likes to visit sidmouth and beer .
daniel is described as white , approximately 6ft ( 1.9m ) tall , with a slim build , with short dark brown hair and is clean shaven .
it is believed he carrying a black rucksack with a green coloured dc logo .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for friday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live
